org.apache.archiva.repository.features

Class IndexCreationFeature

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.archiva.repository.features.AbstractFeature
      • org.apache.archiva.repository.features.IndexCreationFeature
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    RepositoryFeature<IndexCreationFeature>

    public class IndexCreationFeature
extends AbstractFeature
implements RepositoryFeature<IndexCreationFeature>
    This feature provides information about index creation. Repositories that support this feature are able to create indexes and download them from remote repositories. Repositories may have a normal and packed index. A normal index is used by repository search utilities, the packed index is for downloading purpose. A index may have a remote and a local representation. The remote representation is used for downloading and updating the local representation. The feature is throwing a RepositoryIndexEvent, if the URI of the index has been changed.

      • getIndexPath

        public URI getIndexPath()
        Returns the path that is used to store the index. The path may be a absolute URI or relative to the base URI of the repository.
        Returns:
        the uri (may be relative or absolute)

      • setIndexPath

        public void setIndexPath(URI indexPath)
        Sets the path that is used to store the index. The path may be either absolute or a path that is relative to the repository storage path (either a local or remote path).
        Parameters:
        indexPath - the uri to the index path (may be relative)

      • hasIndex

        public boolean hasIndex()
        Returns true, if this repository has a index defined.
        Returns:
